definition: adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack
to dress up in disguise (idiom); to pretend for the purpose of deceit

sentences.english: "Yixing Qiaozhuang" drama be closely linked with gander culture.
sentences.chinese: “易性乔装”剧和我国的性别文化息息相关。

sentences.english: Young kids often dress up and have fun at Halloween.
sentences.chinese: 万圣节前夜，小孩子通常都乔装打扮，玩得很开心。

sentences.english: Nobody knows me in that motorbike. I'm in disguise.
sentences.chinese: 开那车没人认识我，我乔装打扮了一番。

sentences.english: So the dream to disguise herself to the dreamer not understand form.
sentences.chinese: 于是梦要乔装打扮，以梦者看不懂的形式出现。

sentences.english: She disguised herself as a man, but she couldn't disguised her voice.
sentences.chinese: 她把自己乔装成一个男子，介改不了自己的声音。

sentences.english: Immediately organized Bi blue clouds disguised as a woman with a child to catch.
sentences.chinese: 立刻组织毕晓云乔装成带孩子的妇女去抓捕。

sentences.english: So far, the distant person that disguise dresses up is bow-backed show a body eventually.
sentences.chinese: 至此，乔装打扮的辽人驼背终于现身。

sentences.english: He even came here in disguise.
sentences.chinese: 他是乔装打扮跟过来的。

sentences.english: Is he turning out a bit of a hypocrite, and coming into the country to work mischief under a cloak?
sentences.chinese: 他变得有点像伪君子了，乔装改扮了到乡间来害人吗？

sentences.english: The thief disguised himself as a policeman.
He disguised himself as a teacher.
sentences.chinese: 他乔装改扮，俨然就是一位教书先生。

sentences.english: At times you may need disguises.
But don't worry guise the following collaborators seemed to have made the cut: Dr.
sentences.chinese: 不过别担心乔装成以下合作者似乎最终胜出博士。

sentences.english: They have organized③ games and the staff dress up as④ clowns.
sentences.chinese: 他们已经组织游戏，并且职员们也乔装打扮成小丑。

sentences.english: Some said he was a toff in disguise .
sentences.chinese: 有些人说他是个乔装的绅士。

sentences.english: He went into the ballroom in disguise.
sentences.chinese: 他乔装打扮了一下就混进了舞厅。

definition: to dress up in disguise (idiom); to pretend for the purpose of deceit
(of actors) to make up/to disguise oneself
to impersonate/to act the part of sb/to disguise oneself as sb else
(of a woman) to dress as a man (idiom)
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
to fool people (idiom)/to pull the wool over people's eyes
to break a prisoner out of jail
